flags.title: User-Contributed Project
flags.text: This project guide is not managed by MAKE staff.

guide.introduction:
I craft for two reasons: to make things that are hard to find in stores or to make expensive things more cheaply. I started with sewing, but have recently gotten interested in other crafts. I began making glasses out of used bottles when I saw some of these pre-made glasses advertised in one the many weird magazines my parents subscribe to. They were totally overpriced, but I told a friend about them she wanted to know where to get them. At this point, the magazine had already been thrown away, so I tried to find them online and had no luck. However, I did find instructions for how to do it myself, so I gave it a shot. I really enjoy making these and have since made numerous sets as gifts, all received with satisfying ooohs and ahhhs. Plus, it makes going to the liquor store much more interesting—you'll shop for cool bottles instead of what's inside them.

There is a slight learning curve in making these, but you can recycle any mess-ups, so there's no real waste. And remember—you're working with glass, so safety first! I know I look ridiculous with goggles and a mask on, but that's far better that losing an eye.

More info at Wine Bottle Glasses at DIY Magazine
